page.title: 03St.Peter's Church
page.content: This is an Anglican Church which serves a large part of Stockton. It is situated on Yarm Road and was opened in{1880. It is a traditional building with a bell tower at the West End. The construction is mainly of red brick. It can accommodate a congregation of {three hundred. The parish of St. Peter's includes a small chapel at Hartburn. As with all of the other Anglican churches in Stockton, St. Peter's is in the{Diocese of Durham}and is therefore governed by the Bishop of Durham. The present vicar is{Rev. S. Pedley who has recently been appointed as a {Queen's Chaplain.
